card.text: Labrador Retriever\n The perfect family pet

Labrador Retriever is one of the most loved breeds around the world.The breed is easily trainable and makes a perfect family dog. It is one of the most common breeds kept as a pet. They are extremely fond of children and love to make people around them happy.

list.ul: Soft mouth that helps them to hold a raw egg without breaking it.
Strong haunches help them leap into water.
Best guide and also a good drug sniffing dog.
Intelligent, lovable and the best family pet.

list.li: Needs regular exercise to maintain weight
Shed a lot of hair,thus requires grooming
Tolerance to heat: Does not affect

card.text: The adult Labrador has a slightly hard coat, whereas a puppy posseses a soft coat, which does not require much brushing. The undercoat should be brushed regularly to prevent shedding. This will also help your Labrador to stay clean as dead fur is removed from the undercoat.

Hip Dysplasia\n A genetic disorder where the hip bone has a defect in connecting with the hip joint as a result of which the dog may experience pain or lameness in either of the rear legs. One has to ensure that they get a lot of exercise.
Epilepsy or Seizures\n They may experience mild or severe seizures followed by frantic and abnormal behaviour such as running or falling or even being unable to move their limbs.

Eye Defect\n Labrador Retriever has a high chance of developing an eye defect,called the Retinal Dysplasia which causes blind spots in them.It is a genetic defect and can only be prevented by avoiding breeding dogs that have been diagnosed as carrying its gene.

list.li: Compatibility with other pets: Adjusts easily
Compatibility with other dogs: Best buddies

card.text: American Cocker Spaniel\n Small on size but big on fun

A Cocker Spaniel is one of the smallest sporting dog breed.It has an amenable, cheerful and affectionate disposition. A well bred and socialised Cocker Spaniel is gentle, loving, sweet, affectionate and playful and a joyous little bundle.It is one of the most popular breeds in various dog shows where they are used as show dogs and also are a part of agility and obedience activities.

list.ul: Long, floppy, silky ears that fall gracefully to the side of the face.
Beautiful silky coat and are quite popular for their ever wagging tails.
Adorable facial expressions and melting dark almond ring eyes.

list.li: Small size makes them perfect for apartment living.
Always ready to play with their wagging tails.
Intelligent breed and is easy to train.
Grooming is not easy, as it requires a lot of time.
Not the perfect lap dog ,will need exercise.
Tolerance to heat: Does not affect

card.text: Grooming a Cocker Spaniel is one of the most tedious and time consuming tasks. Its long silky fur has to be brushed and groomed regularly else it will get tangled and become extremely painful for the dog. Regular brushing will ensure that there is no tartar or plaque buildup and the mouth of the Cocker Spaniel remains clean .This will also prevent the onset of any periodontal problems.To avoid any injury to the feet especially during running or playing, the nails of the dog should be trimmed regularly and kept short.Many vets advise the trimming of the hair in the inside of the ear so that there is ventilation under the ears,which would avoid the onset of ear infections.

Hip Dysplasia\n A genetic disorder where the hip bone has a defect in connecting with the hip joint as a result of which the dog may experience pain or lameness in either of the rear legs. One has to ensure that they get a lot of exercise.

Hypothyroidism\n The hormone gland of the dog does not function well and as a result, the growth and the development of the dog gets affected. Common symptoms of hypothyroidism include dull fur, extreme lethargy, obesity / weight loss and mental dullness.
Epilepsy\n They may experience mild or severe seizures followed by frantic and abnormal behaviour such as running or falling or even being unable to move their limbs.
Cataracts and Glaucoma\n In case of cataract, a cloudy film forms over the eye of the dog while in case of glaucoma, there is a buildup of fluid pressure inside the eyeball.
Patellar Luxation\n It is the dislocation of the kneecap and can cause crippling in the dog.
Progressive Retinal Atrophy\n PRA is a degenerative disease of the retinal cells that can cause blindness in the dog.
Autoimmune Anemia\n It is a serious condition where the dog’s immune system starts to attack its own blood cells. Visible symptoms include pale gums, fatigue and jaundice.

list.li: Compatibility with other pets: Adjusts easily
Compatibility with other dogs: Adjusts easily

card.text: Irish Setter\n The perfect companion to the active family

This is one of the most boisterous breeds.It loves to run and play. Many proud owners would say that these happy go lucky dogs thrive on physical exercise. The Irish Setter is an easy breed to train.They love to please their owner, which makes it easy to train them.Their exuberance and abundant energy further helps in the training process.

list.ul: Zig zag pattern of running which helps them to catch the scent of the bird or the game.
Majestic looking breed that has abundance of energy and can develop separation anxiety at times.
Amongst the few breeds which come in one coat color.

list.li: Will need a lot of space to run
Tolerance to cold: Does not affect

card.text: Grooming your Irish Setter will take a lot of time and effort.The long and silky coat will need every day brushing to ensure that it remains soft and lustrous. You need to follow the regular grooming regime in your pet i.e brushing the teeth and clipping toe nails.Clipping nails is very important as dog nails have veins in them and if they get chipped then it can be very painful for your pet.
Epilepsy\n They may experience mild or severe seizures followed by frantic and abnormal behaviour such as running or falling or even being unable to move their limbs.

Bloating\n This is caused by the sudden influx of gas and air in the stomach. It can also happen due to a twist in the stomach. If your dog suffers from bloating then the meals should be broken into two to three meals a day.
Progressive Retinal Atrophy\n PRA is a degenerative disease of the retinal cells that can cause blindness in the dog.

list.li: Compatibility with other pets: Finds difficult to adjust
Compatibility with other dogs: Adjusts easily

card.text: Golden Retriever\n This one is for the keeps

Fondly called Goldens, these retriever dogs are one of the most popular pets in the world. They are easy to train, and love their families. Their zeal to please their owners makes them one of the most perfect pets to have at home.

list.ul: Lowest ranking barkers.
Freshest smelling dogs as they do not suffer from bad breath.
Soft mouth that helps them to hold even a raw egg without breaking it.
Exemplary obedience level and intelligence.

list.li: Affectionate pet for the whole family
One of the most obedient dogs, so training will be easy
Low barkers; makes them perfect dogs for apartments in gated communities
Do not make good watch or guard dogs
An active dog needs exercise everyday
Tend to get hyper-active or over-weight, if not made to exercise properly
Tolerance to heat: Does not affect

card.text: Golden Retrievers require regular grooming in order to maintain their beautiful coat.Their hair should be brushed regularly. They generally shed hair in spring and fall. Their ears require special attention at all times.

Hip Dysplasia\n A genetic disorder where the hip bone has a defect in connecting with the hip joint as a result of which the dog may experience pain or lameness in either of the rear legs. One has to ensure that they get a lot of exercise.
Cataract/n In case of cataract, a cloudy film forms over the eye of the dog while in case of glaucoma, there is a buildup of fluid pressure inside the eyeball.

list.li: Compatibility with other pets: Best buddies
Compatibility with other dogs: Best buddies

card.text: Weimaraner\n This one can disappear right in front of your eyes

Weimaraners are graceful, athletic dogs, originally bred to be hunting dogs.They are known for their agility and muscular strength. Weims are intelligent, loyal dogs, who love a good long run in the park and the company of a loving family.

list.ul: Have a lot of energy, so be prepared to exercise them well.
Having originally been bred to hunt, they have low tolerance and high curiosity for smaller animals and birds.
Love the outdoors, and human companionship.

list.li: Not an ideal breed with small animals
Tolerance to heat: Does not affect

card.text: The smooth and short hair coat does not need much grooming. You just need to brush them once a week to get rid of all the loose hair from their bodies. They do not carry a distinctive odour, so a bath once every few weeks is enough.
Hip Dysplasia\n A genetic disorder where the hip bone has a defect in connecting with the hip joint as a result of which the dog may experience pain or lameness in either of the rear legs.
Entropion\n It causes the eyelid to roll inwards thereby irritating and injuring the eyeball. Surgical intervention may be required to correct the problem.
Elbow Dysplasia\n It is a genetic disorder where the bones that comprise the elbow do not join uniformly in the elbow joint causing painful lameness.

Gastric Dilation Volvulus\n This commonly occurs in breeds where the stomach is not attached to the ribs. This can cut off the blood supply to various other parts of the body, which further shuts down the digestion process. Such a situation leads to bloating. It is advisable to not exercise your dog for at least an hour after they have food.

list.li: Compatibility with other dogs: Adjusts easily

card.text: Chow Chow\n A bear and a lion in a dog suit

Chow Chow or Chow as they are popularly known are one of the most beautiful and admired dogs in the world. On first glance, the dog looks like a cross between a lion and a bear as it has a beautiful mane of fur around its head and the facial features resemble that of a bear. Though they look extremely cute and cuddly, they are quite aggresive.

list.ul: Black and blue tongue.
Straight hind legs which can swing back and forth like a pendulum.
Possesses a denture of 44 teeth while other breeds have 42 teeth.

card.text: A Chow Chow has a two layered coat - one rough and one smooth. The top layer of the fur is rough and requires frequent brushing to keep it tangle free and clean. Chows are seasonal shedders and shed heavily. They also require regular baths as their fur gets dirty when they play in the yard or garden. Dental grooming is also a must for a Chow Chow. Regular brushing will ensure that there is no tartar or plaque buildup.
Hip Dysplasia\n A genetic disorder where the hip bone has a defect in connecting with the hip joint as a result of which the dog may experience pain or lameness in either of the rear legs.
Entropion\n It causes the eyelid to roll inwards thereby irritating and injuring the eyeball. Surgical intervention may be required to correct the problem.

list.li: Compatibility with other pets: Adjusts easily
Compatibility with other dogs: Adjusts easily

card.text: Dobermann Pinscher\n Do not be intimidated by the looks of this one

A Doberman Pinscher is a relatively new breed on the block.It possesses an athletic body, sharp ears and high agility.Dobermanns are known for their strength, ferociousness, intelligence,fearlessness and undying loyalty to their family. They are formidable guardians and with their people i.e their family, Doberman Pinschers are gentle, watchful and loving companions.

list.ul: Their athletic body is built for speed and endurance giving them a ferocious yet elegant appearance.
Powerful wedge shaped head gives it a strong profile.
Strongly developed wide scissors teeth bite that attributes to the dog’s ferocious look.

list.li: Minimal shedders and coat does not require much maintenance
Easy to train and have amazing grasping power
Not for first time owners, need experience handling
Does not withstand extreme cold weather
Requires extreme and vigorous exercise not for less active families
Tolerance to heat: Loves warm weather
Tolerance to cold: Does not affect

card.text: Doberman is one of the easiest breeds to groom. The coat of a Doberman Pinscher is short and does not shed much, so they require very little grooming.Its skin is extremely sensitive to extreme cold or heat.Dental grooming is also a must for a Dobermann. Cleaning of ears using ear wipes will help avoid any ear infections or wax buildup.
Hip Dysplasia\n A genetic disorder where the hip bone has a defect in connecting with the hip joint as a result of which the dog may experience pain or lameness in either of the rear legs.

Hypothyroidism\n The hormone gland of the dog does not function well and as a result, the growth and the development of the dog gets affected. Common symptoms of hypothyroidism include dull fur, extreme lethargy, obesity / weight loss and mental dullness.

Gastric Dilation Volvulus\n This commonly occurs in breeds where the stomach is not attached to the ribs. This can cut off the blood supply to various other parts of the body, which further shuts down the digestion process. Such a situation leads to bloating. It is advisable to not exercise your dog for at least an hour after they have food.
Progressive Retinal Atrophy\n It involves gradual deterioration of the retina. As the disease progresses, the dogs may develop night blindness or lose sight during the day.
Narcolepsy\n It is a neurological condition that results in the brain’s inability to regulate wake sleep patterns. A dog with this syndrome may suddenly become sleepy and fall asleep.
Wobbler's Syndrome\n It is an inherited syndrome in which the spinal canal is malformed causing cervical vertebral instability.

Von Willebrand’s Disease\n It is an inherited blood disorder that interferes with the blood’s ability to clot. As a result of this, the dog may bleed excessively after an injury or a surgery. There is no cure for this disease. Dogs with this disease should not be bred.

list.li: Compatibility with other pets: Finds difficult to adjust
Compatibility with other dogs: Best buddies

card.text: Dogue de Bordeaux (French Mastiff)\n The fancy name is the cover for this French Mastiff

Dogue de Bordeaux or a French Mastiff is one of the most ancient dog breeds in the world. It is a typical brachycephalic molossoid type breed with a powerful head and a powerful body. In India, Salman Khan has been the proud owner of two Dogue de Bordeaux.

list.ul: Due to a brachycephalic head, the nose and the face of a Dogue de Bordeaux is short and may cause breathing problems for the dog.
Minimal exercise requirements as overexertion can tire them and cause breathing or heart conditions.
Wrinkled face and a pink nose.

list.li: Great with children in the house
Excellent watch dogs and size can be intimidating
You need to have space in the house for them to move around
Prone to lot of health issues
Tolerance to heat: Does not affect

card.text: They require minimal grooming due to the short fur. Regular bathing will help keep the fur clean. The skin of the Dogue is extremely sensitive to extreme cold or heat. Regular brushingof teeth will ensure that there is no tartar or plaque buildup and the mouth remains clean. Their nails grow really fast.So ,the nails of the dog should be regularly trimmed and kept short.
Hip Dysplasia\n A genetic disorder where the hip bone has a defect in connecting with the hip joint as a result of which the dog may experience pain or lameness in either of the rear legs.
Epilepsy\n They may experience mild or severe seizures followed by frantic and abnormal behaviour such as running or falling or even being unable to move their limbs.

Gastric Dilation Volvulus\n This commonly occurs in breeds where the stomach is not attached to the ribs. This can cut off the blood supply to various other parts of the body, which further shuts down the digestion process. Such a situation leads to bloating. It is advisable to not exercise your dog for at least an hour after they have food.
Corneal Dystrophy\n The cornea of the dog is either underdeveloped or is opaque. This might cause loss of vision to the dog.

Aortic Stenosis\n They may feel lethargic all the time and have have episodes of fainting. When a dog has Aortic Stenosis, the heart works at twice the normal rate to pump blood. It can prove lethal for the dog.

list.li: Compatibility with other pets: Finds difficult to adjust
Compatibility with other dogs: Adjusts easily

card.text: German Shepherd Dog (Alsatian)\n Bring home your very own deputy sergeant

The German Shepherd is one of the most handsome dogs around.Their agility and good looks made them the first canine stars.GSDs are one of the most intelligent dogs and it is a common sight to see them being used a lot in the armed and police forces.

list.ul: Most loyal pets around and are highly protective of their family members.
Very athletic dogs and their intelligence makes them unique.
Their ability to stop at command makes them one of the easiest breeds to train.

list.li: Extremely intelligent and easy to train
Great guide dogs, search and rescue and police dogs
Vary of strangers and can attack to protect family
Need regular exercise to ensure health
Shed heavily and need brushing everyday
Tolerance to heat: Loves warm weather

card.text: This breed sheds heavily , those who have them at home would know that hair can be seen everywhere. The easiest way to avoid this is to brush them everyday. If not brushed regularly then your pet can develop clumps of dirty hair, which will not only make the coat look dull but also make it a breeding ground for infections.

Hip Dysplasia\n A genetic disorder where the hip bone has a defect in connecting with the hip joint as a result of which the dog may experience pain or lameness in either of the rear legs. One has to ensure that they get a lot of exercise.
Epilepsy or Seizures\n They may experience mild or severe seizures followed by frantic and abnormal behaviour such as running or falling or even being unable to move their limbs.
Multiple Sclerosis\n This mostly leads to paralysis in the hind legs and generally strikes in the middle age.
Progressive Retinal Atrophy\n It involves gradual deterioration of the retina. As the disease progresses, the dogs may become night blind or lose sight during the day.

list.li: Playfullness: Ready most of the time
Compatibility with other pets: Adjusts easily
Compatibility with other dogs: Best buddies

card.text: Neapolitan Mastiff (Italian Mastiff)\n You will fall in love with its clumsiness

Their affectionate nature often leads us to believe that they are massive lap dogs. Neos are family's unwavering guardians, with stares more fearful than their intentions. They are quick to protect their family, but are rarely fearsome without good reason.

list.ul: Most defining feature is its numerous luscious folds of skin.
Make great guard dogs, although they are not quick to bite or physically harm strangers.
Known to be silent (AND) stealthy dogs

list.li: While walks are essential, they’re happy to lurk about a lawn or sprawl in the kitchen
Their stare is worse than their bark which is worse than their bite! Even a sleeping Neo is a great guard dog because of size.
Love to cuddle and are full of affection.
You’ll need a big house if a Neo’s got to be wandering around. Small spaces can frustrate them.
Grooming will be time consuming even though Neos are not big shedders.
They’re prone to bloat, which can sometimes be fatal.
Tolerance to heat: Does not affect

card.text: Grooming your Neapolitan Mastiff is not an easy task. Their short coat requires minimum grooming, but the loose skin and wrinkles can trap a lot of dirt and microbes. These have to be cleaned regularly to prevent diseases.
Hip Dysplasia\n A genetic disorder where the hip bone has a defect in connecting with the hip joint as a result of which the dog may experience pain or lameness in either of the rear legs.

Fold Dermatitis\n A skin infection peculiar to animals with loose and wrinkled coat.It is caused by moisture trapped in the folks of the skin. Redness, soreness and a sickly sweet odour are all symptoms of the condition.
Cherry Eye\n The gland under the eye protrudes and looks like a cherry. Surgery will be required to remove the infected gland.
Elbow Dysplasia\n It is a genetic disorder where the bones that comprise the elbow do not join uniformly in the elbow joint causing painful lameness.

list.li: Compatibility with other pets: Finds difficult to adjust
Compatibility with other dogs: Finds difficult to adjust

card.text: Rottweiler\n The guard dog with an iron jaw

Rottweilers are strong, loyal and affectionate dogs.With proper training,they can make excellent pets. They are not ideal for first-time dog families or people who intend to train a dog to be a guard dog, especially if their training methods are aggressive.

list.ul: Large head and strong jaw.
Amongst the few breeds that come only in one colour.
Make excellent guard dogs and companion dogs.
Leaving them alone for long periods of time can lead them to become destructive.

list.li: Excellent guard dogs and protective towards their family
Remarkable dogs for high activity people
Regular training required right from the beginning
Need to be socialized early with people and other animals
Tolerance to heat: Loves warm weather

card.text: They shed heavily throughout the year, so a thorough brushing once or twice a week is a must. As with all other dogs, you will need to concentrate on the oral health of your Rottie. Make sure you familiarise the dog with being groomed from a young age, so that he or she does not have issues with being touch near their ears, eyes and paws.

Hip Dysplasia\n A genetic disorder where the hip bone has a defect in connecting with the hip joint as a result of which the dog may experience pain or lameness in either of the rear legs. One has to ensure that they get a lot of exercise.
Bloating\n Bloat occurs when the stomach is filled with gas and it twists. It advisable to give this pet food in a high stand bowl and you should at least half an hour rest before their exercise.
Osteosarcoma\n A kind of aggressive bone cancer.

list.li: Compatibility with other pets: Finds difficult to adjust
Compatibility with other dogs: Adjusts easily

card.text: Chihuahua\n Is it a toy or is it a dog?

Chihuahua is the world’s smallest breed dog.Their antics and compact size can easily pass them as a child’s toy. They are excellent family pets and thrive in human companionship. Their portability and desire to be a lap dog make them a hit with celebrities around the world.

list.ul: World's smallest breed.
Their size and low activity requirements makes them the perfect companions for apartments and condominiums.
One of the only breeds in the world that comes with a soft spot on the head better known as a molera.

list.li: Size makes them perfectly desirable for pocket dogs
Grooming is a breeze with this toy breed
Does not require much exercise so the perfect dog for small spaces
Very difficult to train need patience and consistency
Cannot be left outdoor for long because of the prey animals
Not viable for cold weather environments prone to frost bites
Tolerance to heat: Loves warm weather
Tolerance to cold: Does not affect

card.text: The Chihuahua comes in two different coat types i.e smooth and long ,and , short and glossy. The smooth coated Chihuahua is easy to maintain. They have to be brushed on a weekly basis. In addition to this you will need to follow the regular grooming regime for your pet like brushing the teeth of your Chihuahua.

Patellar Luxation\n In this the knee joint is displaced causing a lot of pain to the dog. There are times when the regular rubbing caused by the patella can lead to arthritis in a pet. This can be corrected easily through surgery .

Hypoglycemia\n They are prone to Hypoglycemia i.e low blood sugar. It is seen in toy breed puppies. It can be easily treatable in early stages but if not treated in time it can be fatal to the health of your pet.
Heart Murmur\n It is caused when there is a disturbance in the blood flow through the chambers of the heart. It is mostly graded by its loudness with one being very soft to very loud.

list.li: Compatibility with other pets: Adjusts easily
Compatibility with other dogs: Best buddies

card.text: Dachshund\n A hotdog that the whole family can enjoy

A Daschund is fondly called the hotdog because of its shape. It is a fun dog for the complete family as it possesses comical features. They have exceptional amount of courage.Their versatility makes them an adorable breed, and are one of the most popular breeds in US.

list.ul: Have a unique shape and is called as hotdog.
Can trail smells to a large extent and their sensitive nose can follow the trail even after its cold.
Loves to dig, they were bred to hunt.
Daschund has a loud and a deep bark, because of their barrel shaped chest cavity.

list.li: Excellent dogs for all apartment dwellers
Extremely good with all family members
Good watch dogs for the family
Grooming is time consuming in the wire and long haired pets
Training is difficult in this headstrong pet
Tolerance to heat: Loves warm weather
Tolerance to cold: Does not affect

card.text: The smooth coat of Daschund is very easy to maintain. They will require occasional brushing to ensure a smooth and lustrous coat. The Wirehair Daschunds require a little more extensive grooming. They shed lesser than the smooth coat Daschund . Grooming should start right from when they are puppies or else they become temperamental.

Back Problems\n It occurs because of their height, short legs and fragile backs. This can lead to various problems such as intervertebral disk and back pain. Though at times it can be treated with back physiotherapy but there are some cases when a surgery will be required as well.

Leg Problems\n They have short and crooked legs, which are sensitive. If not treated on time,it can lead to various back problems, which need immediate vet attention otherwise, may lead to paralysis. In addition to this they can get various skin allergies.

list.li: Compatibility with other pets: Finds difficult to adjust
Compatibility with other dogs: Adjusts easily

card.text: Mastiff\n This giant can accommodate anywhere

This fantastic dog is one of the most massive dogs when it comes to their size. These are great watchdogs and no one dares to enter their territory because of their massive size. They are big on size but attack anyone only for self defense.

list.ul: Broad head and the shape give rise to massive amounts of drool in your pet.
One of the few giant breeds that do not require a lot of exercise.
Excellent watch dogs and will go and bark at the door whenever someone comes through it.

list.li: They do not need much exercise
Excellent watch dogs and their size can be intimidating
You need to have space in the house for them to move around
Tolerance to heat: Does not affect

card.text: You need to brush the coat once a week with a rubber hound glove. This will help to keep the shedding under control. Wrinkles need to be cleaned on regular basis in order to prevent infections. Brush the teeth regularly to prevent tartar buildup. The toe nails will also be required to be trimmed on a regular basis.

Hip Dysplasia\n A genetic disorder where the hip bone has a defect in connecting with the hip joint as a result of which the dog may experience pain or lameness in either of the rear legs. One has to ensure that they get a lot of exercise.
Bloating\n Bloating occurs when the stomach is filled with gas and it twists. It advisable to give the pet food in a high stand bowl and they should rest at least half an hour before exercising.

Gastric Torsion\n This is a common problem in giant breed dogs. It usually happens when the dog is fed once a day and drinks or eats too fast. There are times when it can result due to immediate exercising after eating.
Progressive Retinal Atrophy\n It involves gradual deterioration of the retina. As the disease progresses, the dogs may develop night blindness or lose sight during the day.

list.li: Compatibility with other pets: Finds difficult to adjust
Compatibility with other dogs: Adjusts easily

card.text: Shih Tzu\n Welcome Nobility into your home

They are one of the most popular breeds.With their beautiful flowing hair and upturned nose, Shih Tzus wear the air of snobbish royalty. They love to adore their family and make new friends wherever they go. They adapt easily to most places.They are equally comfortable in a small apartment and a big house.

list.ul: Amongst the purest breeds in the world.
Wheeze and snore a lot.
Are drawn towards coprophagia i.e the habit of eating their own faeces or that of other animals.

list.li: One of the purest breed in the world, with the safest breeding practices
Do not shed much, makes them perfect for people with allergies
Grooming requires a lot of time and may need professional help
Not an easy breed to train, requiring regular and persistence training
Do not fare well in hot climates
Tolerance to heat: Does not affect

card.text: Shih Tzus have a beautiful coat and a matching personality. Daily brushing and combing is necessary to prevent tangles and mats. Their coats are often buzzed short, especially in warm places. When Shih Tzus are about a year old, the coat changes from soft puppy fluff to the silken adult coat. Grooming might be even more challenging at this time as the matting will increase.
Hip Dysplasia\n A genetic disorder where the hip bone has a defect in connecting with the hip joint as a result of which the dog may experience pain or lameness in either of the rear legs.
Epilepsy or Seizures\n They may experience mild or severe seizures followed by frantic and abnormal behaviour such as running or falling or even being unable to move their limbs.
Elbow Dysplasia\n It is a genetic disorder where the bones that comprise the elbow do not join uniformly in the elbow joint causing painful lameness.

card.list: Dilated Cardiomyopathy\n A condition in which heart muscles become very thin and are unable to contract normally.It is also common in St. Bernards. It can be controlled through medication and diet.

list.li: Playfullness: Ready most of the time
Compatibility with other pets: Adjusts easily
Compatibility with other dogs: Adjusts easily

card.text: Lhasa Apso is a small and adorable looking dog with hair that touch the floor.They look like toys but on the contrary are a feisty breed.They are strong and make excellent watchdogs for the family.

list.ul: Full hair that almost grows to the floor and makes their feet invisible.
Droopy ears with hair inside its ears, which can at times provide the perfect breeding ground to all microbes.
Bred with a heightened sense of hearing and their magnanimous bark surpasses their size.

list.li: Super model looks with its lustrous hair
Needs to be groomed regularly to maintain coat
Not the ideal dog for little kids and toddlers

card.text: They shed very less but their long and lustrous coat makes taming a time consuming affair. You will need to brush your pet’s teeth regularly to prevent formation of plaque and maintain a fresh breath at all times.

Ear Infections\n They are prone to various ear infections because of their long ears, which are filled with hair. This provides a perfect breeding ground for all infections. So, it is extremely important to keep their ears clean at all times.
Progressive Retinal Atrophy\n It involves gradual deterioration of the retina. As the disease progresses, the dogs may become night blind or lose sight during the day.

list.li: Playfullness: Ready most of the time
Compatibility with other pets: Not good
Compatibility with other dogs: Not good

card.text: Yorkshire Terrier\n Bring home this hypoallergenic dog that does not shed

card.list: The Yorkshire Terrier is the most popular toy breed in the US. They are the most popular breed due to their affectionate and playful nature, small size, big personality, and beautiful coat. With the courage of a terrier, and the heart of a lion, this intelligent breed is truly a large dog in a small body.

list.ul: Fearless and have little problem taking on adversaries– real or imagined – several times their size.
Difficult to house train.
Have delicate digestive systems and are known to be picky eaters.

list.li: Guaranteed to turn heads with their beauty
Perfect apartment dogs and family dogs
Quiet intelligent and can be easily trained
Grooming requires a lot of time and effort
Not the best dog to have around small children
Do not fare well in extremely cold weather
Tolerance to heat: Does not affect

card.text: Yorkies are high-maintenance dogs with luxurious coats. Several families resort to keeping the coat on their Yorkies short to facilitate easier grooming. Use a wire pin brush and a stainless steel coat to remove excess hair and keep the coat tangle-free. A Yorkie with dreadlocks is a receptacle for parasites like ticks and fleas. Bathe your Yorkie once a week.

Patellar Luxation\n In this the knee joint is displaced which causes a lot of pain to the dog. There are times when the regular rubbing caused by the patella can lead to arthritis in a pet. This can be corrected through surgery easily.

Hypoglycemia\n They are prone to Hypoglycemia i.e low blood sugar. This is seen in toy breed puppies. It can be easily treatable in early stages but if not treated in time it can be fatal to the health of your pet.
Progressive Retinal Atrophy\n It involves gradual deterioration of the retina. As the disease progresses, the dogs may develop night blindness or lose sight during the day.

Gum problems\n They are prone to various teeth and gum problems that at times can result in difficulty in chewing food. They can have early tooth decay as well, so it is important to ensure that the oral hygiene of this breed is maintained at all times.

list.li: Playfullness: Ready most of the time
Compatibility with other pets: Adjusts easily
Compatibility with other dogs: Adjusts easily

card.text: Poodle (Standard)\n Get a Foo Foo for your home

This is the only dog in the dog kingdom that comes in three sizes i.e. standard, miniature and toy. When it comes to their upkeep then this might be one of the most expensive dog to keep because of its grooming requirements.

list.ul: Does not shed, their hair grows like humans and the inner coat of fur just falls by itself after some time.
Are one of the most intelligent breed.
Perfect breed to train for tricks.

list.li: This is second most intelligent breed in the dog world
Excellent family pets and looks good
Generally an active breed but can be inactive indoors
One of the most expensive breed when it comes to grooming
Can be a little protective about the family
Tolerance to heat: Does not affect

card.text: This breed will rake up your bills when it comes to grooming.It needs to be clipped every six to eight weeks. You need to wipe around the eyes and face every day with an alcohol free wipe. Brushing the teeth of your Poodle on a weekly basis will help to remove all tartar buildup. Also the toe nails will require clipping on regular basis.

Hypothyroidism/n The hormone gland of the dog does not function well and as a result, the growth and the development of the dog gets affected. Common symptoms of hypothyroidism include dull fur, extreme lethargy, obesity / weight loss and mental dullness.
Addison disease\n In this the adrenal glands do not produce the right amount of hormone cortisol and the dog becomes lethargic and depressed. This will have a lifelong treatment.

Legg Calve Perthes disease\n It reduces the blood supply to the head of the thigh bone; this at times can cause it to be deformed. If your puppy starts to limp at an early age then we advise you to take him or her to a vet soon so that it can be corrected early.

list.li: Compatibility with other pets: Finds difficult to adjust
Compatibility with other dogs: Adjusts easily

card.text: Afghan Hound\n Even Noah found them worth saving

An Afghan Hound is one of the most elegant and royal dog breeds in the world. It is also called the King of Sight Hounds. It is considered one of the oldest breeds in the world. Legend has it that an Afghan Hound was one of the dogs that was rescued in Noah’s Arc. Afghan Hounds were originally used as hunting dogs.

list.ul: Sight hounds who hunt by the sight and speed instead of sound and endurance.
Vision angle of 270º compared to 180º in other dogs.
Run really fast, often clocking speeds at 40 miles per hour and thus are referred to as supermodels of the canine world.

list.li: Majestic looking breed with its lustrous coat
Suitable for all weather and terrain
Makes ideal pet for people with high exercise level
Requires a lot a grooming and can even require professional help
Not suitable with small pets and children
Sensitive to pain so requires extra care
Tolerance to heat: Does not effect

card.text: Impeccable grooming of an Afghan Hound is the only way one can maintain its long and lustrous silky coat. The fur of the hound is very fine in texture,and requires regular brushing and frequent baths.Without which it may become tangled or matted and give an unkempt look. It will be advisable to hire the services of professional pet groomers for new owners. The grooming regime should start at an early age. Grooming also checks the skin for sores or rashes as the long fur can harbour infections if not taken care of.

Hip Dysplasia\n A genetic disorder where the hip bone has a defect in connecting with the hip joint as a result of which the dog may experience pain or lameness in either of the rear legs. One has to ensure that they get a lot of exercise.

Hypothyroidism\n The hormone gland of the dog does not function well and as a result, the growth and the development of the dog gets affected. Common symptoms of hypothyroidism include dull fur, extreme lethargy, obesity / weight loss and mental dullness.
Allergies\n Incase your hound has an allergy, he / she may show symptoms similar to humans - sneezing, eye / nasal discharge, itching, hair loss and lethargy.
Elbow Dysplasia\n It is a genetic disorder where the bones that comprise the elbow do not join uniformly in the elbow joint causing painful lameness.
Cancer\n They are more prone to cancer and tumours than any other breed. Symptoms of cancer may include abnormal swelling of a sore / bump that does not heal.

list.li: Playfullness: Ready most of the time
Compatibility with other pets: Finds difficult to adjust
Compatibility with other dogs: Adjusts easily

card.text: Beagle\n Prepare yourself for a thrill ride

A Beagle is a member of the scent hound family. They are one of the most adorable and popular breeds. English Beagles are small, compact and extremely healthy .They make wonderful companions and family dogs. The breed gained popularity when the movie “Cats (AND) Dogs” and “Shiloh” portrayed Beagles as their lead actors.

list.ul: Make friends with the turn of their head. They are happy, outgoing, social and loving.
Extremely inquisitive and are always on a search for an interesting trail to pursue.
Nose is blessed with over 220 million scent receptors.
Have three distinct vocalisations - a bark or a growl, a baying howl and a half baying howl.

list.li: Friendly with children as well as adults
Easy to groom, does not require much effort
One of the healthiest breeds around
One of the most difficult breeds to train
Certainly not for the first time owners
Tolerance to heat: Loves warm weather
Tolerance to cold: Does not affect

card.text: Beagles are easy to maintain and groom.They have a smooth water resistant coat which requires regular brushing to encourage blood circulation and hair growth. Even though Beagles shed, their short fur makes it go unnoticed. Regular baths to keep them clean would be required. As a pet parent you would have to check and clean their ears regularly to avoid ear infections. A grooming regime has to be followed to keep Beagles healthy and infection free.
Epilepsy or Seizures\n They may experience mild or severe seizures followed by frantic and abnormal behaviour such as running or falling or even being unable to move their limbs.

Hypothyroidism\n The hormone gland of the dog does not function well and as a result, the growth and the development of the dog gets affected. Common symptoms of hypothyroidism include dull fur, extreme lethargy, obesity / weight loss and mental dullness.
Cherry Eye\n The gland under the eye protrudes and looks like a cherry. Surgery will be required to remove the infected gland.

Steroid Responsive Meningitis\n A rare combination of meningitis and polyarthritis, this disorder can be extremely painful for the dog.Cervical pain, weakness, body pain, severe muscle spasms and loss of appetite are some of the common symptoms.
Glaucoma\n There is a buildup of fluid pressure inside the eyeball. The pressure in the eye increases manifolds as a result the disorder is extremely painful for the dog.

list.li: Compatibility with other pets: Finds difficult to adjust
Compatibility with other dogs: Adjusts easily

card.text: Borzoi\n If Greyhound is the Ferrari, then this one is a Lamborghini

Borzoi is one of the oldest and purest dog breeds in the world. Designed for speed and endurance, a Borzoi is one of the most elegant, graceful, athletic and beautifully majestic dogs on Earth. They are also called the supermodels of the canine world.

list.ul: Characteristic muzzle and a long narrow head.
Beautiful almond shaped eyes are set high and provide the sharpest vision possible to a Borzoi.
Vision range of 270º compared to 180º for other dogs.

list.li: Tolerance to heat: Does not affect

card.text: Borzois are blessed with long, silky coats that may be flat, wavy or even curly and may come in a combination of colours. Even though the silky coat helps keep the dirt and dust away from the fur, regular grooming is advised. A soft brush can be used to comb and groom the fur. Bathing may be advised based on how dirty the dogs gets. It is important to check for infections while grooming.

Osteochondrosis Dissecans (OCD)\n It is an orthopaedic condition caused by the improper growth of cartilage in the joints especially elbows and shoulders. It results in a painful stiffening of the joint and can be extremely uncomfortable for the dog.
Progressive Retinal Atrophy\n It involves gradual deterioration of the retina. As the disease progresses, the dogs may develop night blindness or lose sight during the day.

Gastric Dilation Volvulus\n This commonly occurs in breeds where the stomach is not attached to the ribs. This can cut off the blood supply to various other parts of the body, which further shuts down the digestion process. Such a situation leads to bloating. It is advisable to not exercise your dog for at least an hour after they have food.

list.li: Playfullness: Ready most of the time
Compatibility with other pets: Adjusts easily
Compatibility with other dogs: Adjusts easily

card.text: Kombai\n A sighthound that is different from the others

Born and bred in Tamil Nadu, India, Kombai is a sight hound par excellence. They make lovable pets and are also known to guard their home and family with their lives. The stocky, muscular Kombai is rumoured to be strong enough to kill a bear. They have very few breed-related health issues, and are capable of living in most types of weather.

list.ul: Its existence can be traced back to the 15th century.
Historically, they are known to have been bred to hunt wild boar, deer, and bison.
Named after the town in which it was found: Kombai in Tamil Nadu.

list.li: Excellent guard dog for the family
Adapts well to all kinds of weather
Has a streak of over-protectiveness and stubbornness that can be misconstrued as aggression
Tolerance to heat: Loves warm weather

card.text: Although the Kombai’s coat is short and coarse, it is known to shed. However, a good brushing once or twice a week is enough to take care of the shedding. They love a good massage, so turn the grooming session into an indulgent spa session, with the use of gentle strokes with a soft brush or hound mitt.

Hip Dysplasia\n A genetic disorder where the hip bone has a defect in connecting with the hip joint as a result of which the dog may experience pain or lameness in either of the rear legs. One has to ensure that they get a lot of exercise.
Anaesthesia\n The breed’s low body fat percentage is the main reason for this.
Dermatitis\n A skin infection peculiar to animals with loose and wrinkled coats, caused by moisture trapped in the folks of the skin.

list.li: Compatibility with other pets: Finds difficult to adjust
Compatibility with other dogs: Finds difficult to adjust

card.text: Dachshund\n A hotdog that the whole family can enjoy

A Daschund is fondly called the hotdog because of its shape. This is a fun dog for the complete family because of its comical features. They have exceptional amount of courage. Their versatility makes them an adorable breed, and are one of the most popular breeds in US.

list.ul: Unique shape and is therefore called hotdog.
Can trail smells to a large extent and their sensitive nose can follow the trail even after its cold.
Loves to dig, they were bred to hunt.
Loud and a deep bark, because of their barrel shaped chest cavity.

list.li: Excellent dogs for all apartment dwellers
Extremely good with all family members
Good watch dogs for the family
Grooming is time consuming in the wire and long haired pets
Training is difficult in this headstrong pet
Tolerance to heat: Loves warm weather
Tolerance to cold: Does not affect

card.text: The smooth coat Daschund is very easy to maintain. They will require occasional brushing to ensure a smooth and lustrous coat. The Wirehair Daschunds require a little more extensive grooming. They shed lesser than the smooth coat Daschund though. The grooming should start right from when they are puppies or else they become temperamental.

Back Problems\n It occurs because of their height,short legs and fragile backs. This can lead to various problems such as intervertebral disk and back pain. Though at times it can be treated with back physiotherapy but there are some cases when a surgery will be required as well.

Leg Problems\n They have short and crooked legs, which are sensitive. If not treated in time can lead to various back problems, which needs immediate vet attention .Otherwise it may also lead to paralysis. In addition to this they can get various skin allergies.

list.li: Compatibility with other pets: Finds difficult to adjust
Compatibility with other dogs: Adjusts easily

card.text: Greyhound\n Get home your very own Ferrari

Greyhounds are regularly used in races. They can adapt to apartment living and make adorable pets. They are excellent with children as they have an even temperament. Their speed has given them the name of Ferrari in the dog kingdom. This majestic breed can attain a top speed of 45 miles per hour.

list.ul: Long elongated skull with a tapering muzzle,and a 270º field of vision.
CIt can touch 45 miles per hour within 30 feet.
Cannot sit on its hind legs on the ground.

list.li: Great family pets as they are even tempered
Not good with younger children because of the speed
Do not fare well in cold and rainy climates
Very thin skin which can easily get cut and may require stitches
Tolerance to heat: Loves warm weather

card.text: Greyhounds have a short coat but they shed profusely. Brush them every day to minimize the shedding . They love being massaged. They tend to have poor dental hygiene, so oral care is a must. Greyhounds do not have a distinct doggy odor. They have a permanent pressed coat and do not require a bath till they are dirty.

Hypothyroidism\n The hormone gland of the dog does not function well and as a result, the growth and the development of the dog gets affected. Common symptoms of hypothyroidism include dull fur, extreme lethargy, obesity / weight loss and mental dullness.

Bloating\n This is caused by the sudden influx of gas and air in the stomach. It can also happen because of a twist in the stomach. If your dog suffers from bloating then the meals should be broken into two to three meals a day.

list.li: Compatibility with other pets: Finds difficult to adjust
Compatibility with other dogs: Adjusts easily

card.text: Indian Pariah Dog\n One of our own

They are amongst the few breeds that originate in India. These homebred or the pure village dogs do need much maintenance and make adorable family pets if you socialize them early. Not all of the street dogs that you may see are Indian Pariah Dog. The pure breds can adapt to any Indian weather,and are a healthy and hardy breed.

list.ul: One of the most adaptable dogs and can survive any Indian weather.
One of the healthiest breeds around as they are not prone to any specific medical conditions.
Free of most allergies and skin infection.

list.li: There can be times when they can fall prey to almost any disease due to numerous reasons.
Tolerance to heat: Loves warm weather
Tolerance to cold: Does not affect

card.text: Indian Pariah dogs do not require much maintenance when it comes to their grooming. They shed throughout the year but the absence of undercoat ensures that you do not see hair all over the house. Regular brushing will minimize this problem. They have less oil glands on the coat, which helps to prevent any odor and also helps them to stay clean.

They are one of the healthiest dogs as they have evolved by themselves, making them least susceptible to any disease. Though, there can be times when your pet can fall prey to almost any disease. This may happen because of numerous reasons.

list.li: Compatibility with other pets: Finds difficult to adjust
Compatibility with other dogs: Adjusts easily

card.text: Bull Dog\n Get home your very own mascot

Several institutions like Yale University, American Army and Marine Corps etc have adopted the English Bulldogs as their team mascot. They are extremely confident dogs. They are extremely tenacious in nature.They were used by ancient Romans in a bloody sport called Bull Baiting. Bulldogs have also featured in the popular cartoon "Tom and Jerry".

list.ul: Extremely heavy and powerful dogs.
Cannot swim and would drown.
Breathe through their mouths.
Tend to fart a lot as they gulp a lot of air while breathing.

list.li: Need to keep the wrinkles clean
Tolerance to heat: Does not affect

card.text: English Bulldogs have a short, fine textured ,smooth and glossy coat.They also have soft loose skin on the head, neck and shoulders. Bulldogs require impeccable grooming everyday. Since they breathe from their mouth, their nose tends to get dry and with time flaky.It is advisablt to consult a veterinarian and apply a soothing ointment such as petroleum jelly to keep the nose soft. Bulldogs do not shed much.

Hip Dysplasia\n A genetic disorder where the hip bone has a defect in connecting with the hip joint as a result of which the dog may experience pain or lameness in either of the rear legs. One has to ensure that they get a lot of exercise.
Cherry Eye\n The gland under the eye protrudes and looks like a cherry. Surgery will be required to remove the infected gland.

Dry Eye\n It is caused when the tear gland does not produce sufficient tears hence giving the eye a dry appearance or a blue haze. It is a painful problem and the vet may prescribe medication or tear drops.
Flatulence\n Since bulldogs breathe from their mouth, they have very high levels of flatulence.

list.li: Compatibility with other pets: Finds difficult to adjust
Compatibility with other dogs: Adjusts easily

card.text: Dalmatian\n Get your very own celebrity

Dalmatians are one of the best known and well recognised dogs in the world.They are lovable, large sized white dogs. Dalmatians were one of the first breeds that former President George Washington bred himself. Dalmatians gained popularity after they featured in the Disney movies :101 and 102 Dalmatians.

list.ul: Dalmatian puppies are not born with spots.
Blessed with a stocky body and strong muscles.
Known to be selective listeners and extremely independent and stubborn in nature.

list.li: Energy bundles and love to play
Need specialized food for urinary tract
Has to be trained right from puppyhood
Tolerance to heat: Loves warm weather
Tolerance to cold: Does not affect

card.text: Dalmatians are one of the easiest breeds to groom. Blessed with a short coat, the spots on a Dalmatian come in two different colours - black or dark brown on a white base fur. The coat of a Dalmatian requires minimal grooming.Dental grooming is also a must for them. While grooming, check for any rashes or redness in the skin, especially between the paws and the ears.

Hip Dysplasia\n A genetic disorder where the hip bone has a defect in connecting with the hip joint as a result of which the dog may experience pain or lameness in either of the rear legs. One has to ensure that they get a lot of exercise.
Skin Allergies\n Due to their white colour, Dalmatians are extremely prone to developing skin allergies. Medical intervention will be required for the management of the allergies.
Iris Sphincter Dysplasia\n It is an inherited disorder can cause sensitivity to bright light and may lead to full or partial blindness and development of cataracts.

Urinary Tract Stones\n The high level of uric acid in their urine is the main cause for the development of the stones. Small stones may pass in the urine, while large stones may get lodged in the tract.

Deafness\n 8% of Dalmatians are born deaf and about 22 - 24% are born with hearing in one ear only. It is an inherited trait and may be passed on to the puppies. A BAER (Brainstem Auditory Evoked Response) is a suggested test to determine if a puppy is deaf or not.

list.li: Compatibility with other pets: Finds difficult to adjust
Compatibility with other dogs: Adjusts easily

card.text: German Spitz\n The furry living toy

It is very easy to confuse this breed for a Pomeranian. Most of the small, white and furry dogs are Spitzes. German Spitzes are easy to train, a little persistence will ensure basic training. Their alert and loyal nature makes them easy to train. Training may be easy but remember that grooming your pet will be a time consuming effort.

list.ul: Has a dominating temperament though docile.
Can quickly become the leader or the boss of the house.
One of the perfect breeds to be kept in an apartment
Bark obsessively at times, which may be a problem.

list.li: Perfect for apartment and condominium living
Excellent pets for the family, especially children
Easy to train because of good intelligence level
Grooming is easy but will require time
Tolerance to heat: Does not affect
Tolerance to cold: Likes cold weather

card.text: The German Spitz comes in a variety of colors.The common colors include white, orange and black. When it comes to long-hair dogs this is rather a low maintenance breed. It has a silky texture, which does not trap mud or dirt easily. You will need to brush them at least three times a week. These Spitzes shed heavily twice a year. A proper dental and grooming regime should be followed.
Luxating Patella\n This is a common problem in small dogs. In this condition the kneecap is dislocated, which is inside and outside the leg and can move in both directions.

Eye Infections\n These are the red and brown stains that are visible on the corner of the eyes of your Spitz. This usually becomes lesser as the puppy grows up. This does not cause any infections in your pet.

list.li: Playfullness: Ready most of the time
Compatibility with other pets: Finds difficult to adjust
Compatibility with other dogs: Adjusts easily

card.text: Pug\n This little pooch is a piece of history

Pugs are the jesters of the canine world.They have a comical face and hilarious personalities.They are one of the most popular breeds. As it is loving, intelligent and naughty, the pug makes for a great first-time dog. They’re gluttons for love and easy to groom.They are always ready with an antic that will make you laugh.

list.ul: Wheeze, snort and snore rather loudly, an endearing characteristic for most pugs.
Shed a lot and are not known to be great barkers.
Need constant human attention and affection.

list.li: Brachycephalic face leads to several respiratory and eye conditions
Tolerance to heat: Does not affect

card.text: Pugs need plenty of attention in grooming. They shed a whole lot and need regular grooming. Pugs have a double coat: a soft undercoat and a coarser topcoat. The numerous wrinkles on their faces can be a health hazard, if they aren’t cleaned regularly. Moisture trapped in their folds is a great magnet for infections, so remember to dry after you clean.
Distichiasis\n An abnormal growth of eyelashes on the margin of the eye.
Entropion\n It causes the eyelid to roll inwards thereby irritating and injuring the eyeball. Surgical intervention may be required to correct the problem.
Walking Dandruff\n A contagious skin condition that is caused by a small mite.
Proptosis\n Never tug on their collars too hard; it can cause their eyes to pop right out of their sockets. This condition is called proptosis and will need surgery to be corrected.
Progressive Retinal Atrophy\n It involves gradual deterioration of the retina. As the disease progresses, the dogs may develop night blindness or lose sight during the day.

list.li: Playfullness: Ready most of the time
Compatibility with other pets: Adjusts easily
Compatibility with other dogs: Adjusts easily

card.text: Pomeranian\n Bring home a living toy

Pomeranians are known all over the world as perhaps the most popular toy breed. Their ancestors were much larger than them. The breed gained popularity in the 17th century,thanks to Queen Victoria who fell in love with them and bred and raised several Pomeranians.

list.ul: Small and compact size.
Can easily find their way between your feet and even get stepped on.
Are best avoided when very small children are around, more so for the safety of the dog than the child.

list.li: Look like an adorable toy and lap up love
Fit into tiny apartments and big hearts just as easily
Excellent companions for older children and senior citizens
Not the best guard dogs, although quick to bark
Known to be stubborn during training
High-maintenance in their desire for love and grooming
Tolerance to heat: Does not affect
Tolerance to cold: Does not affect

card.text: Poms require low maintanence but grooming them isn’t the easiest thing. They need to be groomed at least twice a week. They are moderate seasonal shedders. Males shed once a year, while females shed when in heat, soon after they’ve given birth to a litter and when they’re stressed out. During the summer months, it is best to crop the hair shorter.

Hip Dysplasia\n A genetic disorder where the hip bone has a defect in connecting with the hip joint as a result of which the dog may experience pain or lameness in either of the rear legs. One has to ensure that they get a lot of exercise.
Cataract\n In case of cataract, a cloudy film forms over the eye of the dog while in case of Glaucoma, there is a buildup of fluid pressure inside the eyeball.

Patellar Luxation\n Here the knee joint is displaced causing a lot of pain to the dog. There are times when the regular rubbing caused by the patella can lead to arthritis in a pet. This can be corrected easily through surgery.

Allergies\n Your dog can suffer from allergies from mere contact or can just have food allergies. The most common sign of an allergy will be when your dog starts to lick his paws or rubs its face a great deal.

list.li: Playfullness: Ready most of the time
Compatibility with other pets: Finds difficult to adjust
Compatibility with other dogs: Finds difficult to adjust

card.text: Pekingese\n Bow down to Royalty

Living with a Pekingese is akin to living with royalty. They are known for their boldness, independence, and courage. Pekes are happiest when in your arms or at least at arm’s length from you. Affectionate and cuddly, this breed is a quintessential lap dog.

list.ul: Known to make great one-person dogs.
Like to be the child in the family.
Have a brachycephalic skull.

list.li: Perfect companions for families with elderly members
One of the most difficult breeds to train
Not good with children; can snap or bite
Grooming requires a lot of time and energy
Tolerance to heat: Does not affect

card.text: Pekingese need daily brushing. They are average shredders and have a long and coarse top coat, with a dense and furry undercoat. The wrinkles around the eye need to be cleaned everyday. It is advisable to keep a short coat on your Peke.

Patellar Luxation\n Here the knee joint is displaced causing a lot of pain to the dog. There are times when the regular rubbing caused by the patella can lead to arthritis in a pet. This can be easily corrected through surgery.

Respiratory Issues\n The brachycephalic face gives rise to various respiratory issues. This is a common problem in dogs with shortened or flat faces. Conditions such as soft palate and narrowed nostrils are common.

list.li: Compatibility with other pets: Finds difficult to adjust
Compatibility with other dogs: Finds difficult to adjust

card.text: Akita\n Welcome both Health and Well Being into your home

Akita is a majestic breed to look at and need experienced handling. Akita is closely associated with royalty. In fact it is believed that in Japan when someone is sick or pregnant, a small statue of an Akita is given to bring in wealth and luck into the family. Akita Inu is an excellent guard dog and an extremely active large breed dog.

list.ul: Temperamental dog that can at times turn to aggression as well.
dominant towards the same sex dogs to establish supremacy.
Large breed dog ,thus they are not the perfect pets for apartments and condominiums.

list.li: Excellent guard dog for the family
Can make affectionate and loyal pets for the family
You share your pet with all-time great pet Hachiko
This is not a good pet with small children around
Sheds a lot and fur can be seen everywhere
Training is a tough task with this breed
Tolerance to heat: Does not affect

card.text: Akita's have a double coat.The top coat is straight and the undercoat is soft and dense and this is the one that sheds all year round. This breed is used to living in colder climates so will shed more in warmer climates. You will need to brush the coat at least once a week and in shedding season almost every day. In addition to this you will need to follow a regular grooming regime with your pet.
Hip Dysplasia\n A genetic disorder where the hip bone has a defect in connecting with the hip joint as a result of which the dog may experience pain or lameness in either of the rear legs.

Hypothyroidism\n The hormone gland of the dog does not function well and as a result, the growth and the development of the dog gets affected. Common symptoms of hypothyroidism include dull fur, extreme lethargy, obesity / weight loss and mental dullness.
Epilepsy\n They may experience mild or severe seizures followed by frantic and abnormal behaviour such as running or falling or even being unable to move their limbs.

Gastric Dilation Volvulus\n This commonly occurs in breeds where the stomach is not attached to the ribs. This can cut off the blood supply to various other parts of the body, which further shuts down the digestion process. Such a situation leads to bloating. It is advisable to not exercise your dog for at least an hour after they have food.

list.li: Playfullness: Ready most of the time
Compatibility with other pets: Finds difficult to adjust
Compatibility with other dogs: Finds difficult to adjust

card.text: Boxer\n Boxing its way into your home

Boxers are one of the happiest breeds in the entire canine world.They have deep dark eyes, poised yet imposing disposition,and a large muscular square head. Boxers are aptly named as they have the tendency to get on their hind legs and throw a punch. Unlike other dogs, Boxers fully mature at the age of 3 years. Several famous celebrities own a Boxer.

list.ul: Abnormally long tongue.
Unusual shape of the skull, called the brachycephalic skulls,
For years their tails and ears have been docked and cropped.

list.li: Perfect family parts for all children and adult
One of the easiest breed to train
Easy to groom, does not require much effort
Does not fare well in extreme temperatures
Tolerance to heat: Loves warm weather
Tolerance to cold: Does not affect

card.text: Boxers are one of the easiest breeds to groom.Boxers come in three different fur colours - fawn, brindle and white - with or without markings.They have a sleek and short coat. The coat of a Boxer requires minimal grooming and often they are known to groom themselves. Boxers can shed quite a bit, so using a soft bristle brush weekly will keep the shedding under control. Regular bathing will help keep the fur clean. Boxer is extremely sensitive to extreme cold or heat.
Hip Dysplasia\n A genetic disorder where the hip bone has a defect in connecting with the hip joint as a result of which the dog may experience pain or lameness in either of the rear legs.

Hypothyroidism\n The hormone gland of the dog does not function well and as a result, the growth and the development of the dog gets affected. Common symptoms of hypothyroidism include dull fur, extreme lethargy, obesity / weight loss and mental dullness.

Aortic Stenosis\n They may feel lethargic all the time and have have episodes of fainting. When a dog has Aortic Stenosis, the heart works at twice the normal rate to pump blood. It can prove lethal for the dog.
Corneal Dystrophy\n The cornea of the dog is either underdeveloped or is opaque. This might cause loss of vision to the dog.

Cancer\n Excessive white marking on a Boxer makes it more prone to developing skin cancer and tumours. As a precautionary measure, apply sunscreen to your dog, especially on the ears, muzzle and paws to protect them from the harmful sunrays.
Deafness\n According to research, Boxers are prone to deafness. Studies have shown that about 18% of white Boxers are born deaf either in one ear or both.

list.li: Compatibility with other pets: Adjusts easily
Compatibility with other dogs: Adjusts easily

card.text: Bull Mastiff\n Do not judge a book by its cover

A Bullmastiff is a tall, proud, courageous and yet one of the gentle giants of the canine world.Bullmastiffs fall in the category of dogs that bark very less. Even while on guard, they would not bite their prey but rather pin them down for as long as required. They are also known to be the “Best Kissers” of the canine world.

list.ul: Unless alarmed, Bullmastiffs can go on days without barking.
Despite their large size and formidable built,they are one of the most gentle dogs around.
Their large size also makes them low energy lazy dogs.

list.li: Perfect guard dog for the family
Does not bite or harm its prey just pins it down
Easy maintenance does not require much grooming
It is not easy to train, needs persistence
Does not fare well to heat, prone to heat exhaustion
Drools need to carry a towel at all times
Tolerance to heat: Does not affect

card.text: Bullmastiffs are one of the easiest dogs to maintain and groom. They do not shed a lot, so grooming or brushing the coat with a brush is suitable. Bathing is recommended as and when needed.The ears can be wiped clean using a soft cleaning ear pad. For comfort in walking, it will be imperative to trim the nails of the dog regularly. Dental grooming is also a must for the Bullmastiff.
Hip Dysplasia\n A genetic disorder where the hip bone has a defect in connecting with the hip joint as a result of which the dog may experience pain or lameness in either of the rear legs.

Hypothyroidism\n The hormone gland of the dog does not function well and as a result, the growth and the development of the dog gets affected. Common symptoms of hypothyroidism include dull fur, extreme lethargy, obesity / weight loss and mental dullness.
Entropion\n It causes the eyelid to roll inwards thereby irritating and injuring the eyeball. Surgical intervention may be required to correct the problem.

Gastric Dilation Volvulus\n This commonly occurs in breeds where the stomach is not attached to the ribs. This can cut off the blood supply to various other parts of the body, which further shuts down the digestion process. Such a situation leads to bloating. It is advisable to not exercise your dog for at least an hour after they have food.

Aortic Stenosis\n They may feel lethargic all the time and have have episodes of fainting. When a dog has Aortic Stenosis, the heart works at twice the normal rate to pump blood. It can prove lethal for the dog.
Elbow Dysplasia\n It is a genetic disorder where the bones that comprise the elbow do not join uniformly in the elbow joint causing painful lameness.

Cancer\n They are more prone to cancer and tumours than any other breed. Some of the common forms of cancer that may inflict a Bullmastiff are lymphosarcoma, mast cell tumours, osteosarcoma and hemangiosarcoma.

list.li: Compatibility with other pets: Finds difficult to adjust
Compatibility with other dogs: Adjusts easily

card.text: Great Dane\n Befriending a gentle giant for life

A Great Dane is commonly called the gentle giant of the dog world because of their perfect temperament. Due to their formidable size, it is safe to call them one of the world’s tallest dog breeds. Although, with great stature comes great costs; they are likely to knock down objects in their way including the young humans and the frailbodied.

list.ul: At about 12 months of age,they are bigger than a 5 year old human
They feel that they are better lap dogs than Chihuahuas and French Bulldogs
Shows puppy behaviour till about 3 years of age

list.li: Prone to bloat and joint problems
Tolerance to heat: Loves warm weather
Tolerance to cold: Does not affect

card.text: Grooming a Great Dane is not much of a task.Their short hair coat do not need much effort in grooming. They do not shed a lot but due to larger surface area, hair is seen lying around the house. Their paws and nails require great care. They require regular care to maintain oral hygiene.Their ears should be cleaned regularly to prevent infections.
Hip Dysplasia\n A genetic disorder where the hip bone has a defect in connecting with the hip joint as a result of which the dog may experience pain or lameness in either of the rear legs.

Bloating\n This is caused by the sudden influx of gas and air in the stomach. This can also happen because of a twist in the stomach. If your dog suffers from bloating then the meals should be broken into two to three meals a day.

list.li: Playfullness: Ready most of the time
Compatibility with other pets: Adjusts easily
Compatibility with other dogs: Best buddies

card.text: St.Bernard\n The Four Legged Angel of Life

The large, grizzly St. Bernard is very gentle.It has a warm heart, incredible intelligence and a majestic aura that can put royalty to shame. St. Bernards have saved the lives of many travellers. They are even tempered and calm dogs, thus make excellent pets for families with kids. They bring warmth and joy to the family.

list.ul: Giant dogs.
Can survive and thrive in the harsh cold weather of the Alps
Drool heavily and shed a lot of fur.

list.li: Great family dog, full of love and loyalty
Highly intelligent and easy to train
Lot of health issues because of their massive size
Drool a lot and need constant cleaning
Prone to heatstroke and heat exhaustion, especially in warmer climates

card.text: Saint Bernards come in two coat types, short-haired and long-haired. The short coat is smooth but dense. The long haired coat, on the other hand, is wavy and the forelegs have a bit of feathering along with a bushy tail. They will need to be brushed at least three to four times a week and need not be bathed regularly.
Hip Dysplasia\n A genetic disorder where the hip bone has a defect in connecting with the hip joint as a result of which the dog may experience pain or lameness in either of the rear legs.
Epilepsy\n They may experience mild or severe seizures followed by frantic and abnormal behaviour such as running or falling or even being unable to move their limbs.
Elbow Dysplasia\n It is a genetic disorder where the bones that comprise the elbow do not join uniformly in the elbow joint causing painful lameness.
Dilated Cardiomyopathy\n A condition in which heart muscles become very thin and are unable to contract normally, is common in St. Bernards. This can be controlled through medication and diet.

list.li: Playfullness: Ready most of the time
Compatibility with other pets: Adjusts easily
Compatibility with other dogs: Adjusts easily

card.text: Siberian Husky\n They will behold you with those penetrating eyes

The Siberian Huskies are known and loved all over the world for their beauty.They have gorgeous coats, unique markings and icy eyes.They are immensely intelligent and active dogs. They are not meant for first time dog owners. They are not meant for hot climates.

list.ul: Don’t usually do too well in apartments and hot climates.
Are called the Houdini of the canine world.
Likely to run off during walks, hence a leash is a must.

list.li: Exceptionally good looking; one of the most majestic breed in the world
Make great family pets for experienced owners
Shed all the year round, and more so in warm climates
Great escape artists that cannot be taken out without a leash
Will not do well in enclosed areas and warm weather
Tolerance to heat: Loves warm weather

card.text: Huskies shed twice a year – in spring and in fall. The Siberian Husky has a double coat of medium length hair. The top coat is straight and the undercoat is soft and dense. You will need to brush the coat at least twice a week and, in shedding season, almost every day. They do not have any distinct canine odour.
Cataract\n In case of cataract, a cloudy film forms over the eye of the dog while in case of glaucoma, there is a buildup of fluid pressure inside the eyeball.
Corneal Dystrophy\n The cornea of the dog is either underdeveloped or is opaque. This might cause loss of vision to the dog.
Progressive Retinal Atrophy\n It involves gradual deterioration of the retina. As the disease progresses, the dogs may become night blind or lose sight during the day.

list.li: Playfullness: Ready most of the time
Compatibility with other pets: Adjusts easily
Compatibility with other dogs: Adjusts easily

card.text: Border Collie\n An IQ that can leave you with envy

This breed has been specifically bred for its intelligence and obedience. Blessed with high energy, stamina and work drive, they are still being used as herding dogs on sheep farms and ranches around the world.

list.ul: Known as the rocket scientists of the canine world.
The stare of this dog is supposed to be so intense that nothing can escape from it.
Have the ability to move quickly in a crouching position like a stalking cat.

list.li: The most trainable dog in the dog kingdom
Exercise and training is a must
Tolerance to heat: Does not affect
Tolerance to cold: Does not affect

card.text: Frequent brushing is required during the shedding season.They don't need regular baths. Brushing teeth will ensure that there is no tartar or plaque buildup and prevent gum diseases. It will be advisable to trim their nails regularly to avoid pain during walking.
Hip Dysplasia\n A genetic disorder where the hip bone has a defect in connecting with the hip joint as a result of which the dog may experience pain or lameness in either of the rear legs.
Epilepsy\n They may experience mild or severe seizures followed by frantic and abnormal behaviour such as running or falling or even being unable to move their limbs.
Progressive Retinal Atrophy\n It involves gradual deterioration of the retina. As the disease progresses, the dogs may become night blind or lose sight during the day.
Collie Eye Anomaly\n It is another inherited condition that causes changes and abnormalities in the eye which may lead to blindness.

list.li: Compatibility with other pets: Adjust easily
Compatibility with other dogs: Best buddies

card.text: The most important thing you need to know is that the diet for dogs doesn’t change much according to the breed type. All the dogs share almost a common diet plan. The only thing that varies is the quantity of food they should have depending on their age or their health conditions.

Food given to your puppy should be high in calories and nutritional supplements. They should be fed more times a day but in less amount. Initially, puppies just reside on milk till 8 weeks. After that, he/she starts adjusting to the solid food. And do not feed them puppy food for too long.

It can be little difficult for your dog to shift from kibble food to raw feed as they grow big. But never try to mix both of them as it will only confuse the dog’s digestive system and lead to explosive diarrhea. Dogs may need a couple days to get used to the new food. Don’t feed your dogs any kind of sugary products. It’s harmful.

Stick to fairly basic foods at first, like turkey and chicken necks. Dogs love to gnaw and chew bones, so this will come natural to them. Once they’ve figured out how to chew, you can start adding different meats. If you want to feed your dog with normal chapattis, rice or vegetables, go for it. It’s perfectly fine.

How can I tell if a food is right for my pet?\n If your dog appears to be thriving on the food and has a glossy coat, lots of energy, and a fit appearance, the food agrees with him. If your pet has a dull coat and lacks energy, try another kind of food.

How much food should my adult dog eat each day?\n That depends on the size of the dog, its age, and how much exercise it gets. Assess your pet’s activity level. Working dogs like police dogs may need food which has a higher fat content to provide extra calories. Next, you may need to make adjustments based on your pet’s body condition.

What should I do if my dog is overweight?\n Give less food or switch to a high-fiber, low-calorie dog food. It’s important to not give too much food or your dog won’t lose weight. But it is equally important to give enough, or your dog can lose weight too quickly and become sick.

How often should my adult dog eat?\n Most pet owners prefer feeding an adult dog twice a day, although a dog can eat just once daily. Giving two meals a day may make it easier for the dog to digest the food and helps control hunger.

How much protein and fat does my dog need?\n An adult dog needs at least 10% of its daily calories from protein and a minimum of 5.5% from fats. An adult dog’s diet can contain up to 50% carbohydrates, including 2.5% to 4.5% percent fiber.

Don’t dogs choke on bones?\n Not on raw ones. Cooked bones splinter, and they can get lodged in a dog’s throat. Raw bones are pliable, and the calcium content is absolutely integral to a dog’s health. Plus, chewing bones keeps the teeth clean. No more astronomical dental bills!

What about food-borne bacteria? Isn’t raw meat dangerous?\n Wolves seem to do just fine eating days-old carrion. Dogs’ stomachs are equipped to handle bacteria in much the same fashion, so don’t worry about contamination. Still, humans are vulnerable, so wash up!

What if my dog is constipated?\n Again, the straining is actually good for your dog. But if it absolutely refuses to come out, a little raw canned pumpkin (not pumpkin pie filling) will do the trick. Raw pumpkin also firms loose stools.

How much should I feed?\n Let’s use a sixty-pound retriever mix as an example. Assuming it gets plenty of exercise, feeding about a pound and a half to two pounds of assorted meats and bones is plenty. Everything varies from dog to dog, of course. If you can’t feel its ribs, reduce the food. If its ribs are a little too prominent, feed more.

Just meat?\n Vegetables can be added to your dog’s diet. In fact, it is recommended. Carrots are fun to crunch, and broccoli, spinach, and celery can be ground up and added to a mixture of ground meat. Supplementing with fish oil is also recommended for a shiny, healthy coat.
